channel.title: Prestige Worldwide
channel.description:
The name is not official but I think it is a good start.
Welcome to back to basics. Here I will be picking up the hyperion base and integrating MYSQL and XStream. The reason I will be using MYSQL is simply [url=http://www.mysql.com/why-mysql/topreasons.html]HERE[/url]. It really is a powerful tool and I advise everybody to learn it (especially if your going to be using my release). I will also be using XStream for XML integration. If you want a basic guide on XStream you can visit [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,355143.msg2718737.html#msg2718737]here[/url]
Don't expect any skills or bosses or whatever you guys expect. This is just more about the back end of a server. I will come back later and elaborate more about my project and even provide snippets of progress as well as answering questions etc.
Below is the rs2_players table where all the players basic information will be stored. This is just a basic example, as you can see a lot more needs to be added. Also "h" is height and it is unsigned because the value is unable to go negative. I will have to double check this. [code] CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `rs2_players` ( `username` varchar(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `pass` varchar(20) NOT NULL, `creation_date` int(10) unsigned NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `x` int(5) unsigned DEFAULT '3000', `y` int(5) unsigned DEFAULT '3000', `h` int(10) unsigned DEFAULT '0', `energy` int(10) DEFAULT '0', `skull` int(10) unsigned DEFAULT '0', `splitChat` tinyint(1) unsigned DEFAULT '0', `autoRetaliate` tinyint(1) unsigned DEFAULT '0', } [/code]
Please note I am not a MYSQL expert or anything so if you see something I can improve or fix let me know :S

item.title: Prestige Worldwide
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

As for passwords, yes there will be some type of encryption. I would rather use just MD5 hash algorithm for password encryption. Just depends on who is behind the server and their preference.

Although MD5 is simple and easy to decrypt especially since a simple google search can do the trick. I would rather do something simple. If somebody does have the knowledge to break through security and dump a database I am sure they have the knowledge to decrypt a password whatever the encryption is. Another thing to note is who would use a real/meaningful password on a pserver? In my view the initial security of the data base should lie in the hands of the admin/owner.

@usman555
If there are more advanced people out there they could defiantly look over the structure of each database and see if things are efficient as possible. As for the project being aimed towards beginners… I will be releasing a full tutorial how to use my release with explanation on how everything works.

Read full topic

item.title: Prestige Worldwide
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I wouldn’t suggest storing the plaintext password in the database. Upon registration of a new player, I would generate a random salt, hash the plaintext password with the salt, then just store the hashed value and the salt in the database. Yeah it might take another column, but it increases the security of the account exponentially.

Read full topic

item.title: Prestige Worldwide
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

This is really great and can be really useful to beginners to MySQL. Good luck with this development.

Read full topic

item.title: Prestige Worldwide
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

m1lkman:

Haha, I love to see projects like this, I’m going to be taking a 2 year course on mySQL and php etc in the fall so I can really look forawrd to revising and making my own type of server like what your doing.

Just to point it out I will not being using any PHP at all… but you gave me the idea to integrate it with a forum. Maybe I should do that. Giving an old friend a hand it will most likely be fluxbb.

I am not making my own server. Just using hyperion and changing things around to my preference and instead of flatfile storage for players everybodys data will be saved to MYSQL.

After all the work I put into this so far I am thinking about not releasing it though. I really want to release it but it just seems like way to much work to do for free. Maybe I will host my own server with it before release. Not so sure yet. 50/50

Read full topic

item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

Well if you look at the project in an IDE the folders come out to be more appealing again you won’t have to worry about this on this project because you really don’t need to edit anything really unless you want to do something with data storage.

Update: Right now I am in the process of rearranging the hyperion folder tree + removing the flat file player storage.

Read full topic

item.title: Prestige Worldwide
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

I just don’t like all the folders, I downloaded a server in the base server section and most of the folders had only one file in it with like 6 other folders, just too confusing :o

Read full topic

item.title: Prestige Worldwide
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

The reason there is 30 folders is because of project management. People rather have things spread out and more organized because it is appealing to the eye. As you become more familiar with the source (such as hyperion) you will realize the importance of each file and you as the developer can choose how you want to arrange things. As for hyperion…its Graham, one of the most knowledable people in this community and I am sure he knows what he is doing.

As for this project. It will be packed into the hyperion src and it won’t be a giant branch but it will be decent. You really wont even need to look at it because most of the development server owners will be doing is the game server.

Read full topic

item.title: Prestige Worldwide
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

What I don’t get with the base servers in the base server section is why they have like 30 folders, I just like a bin folder, src folder, and my run/compile.

item.title: Prestige Worldwide
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

The nice thing about this project is that the only thing server owners will need to do is click edit and change values (such as making their character admin which would be like 3 clicks) I am doing all the nasty mind thinking work. But when its done and released I will be releasing a full beginners guide to MYSQL to give people easy access! It not hard to learn and only takes basic understanding.

Read full topic

item.title: Prestige Worldwide
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:8, topic:387939”][quote author=kingman002 link=topic=483758.msg3544459#msg3544459 date=1301096932]
Okay so whats your goals and all that?
[/quote]

Thanks for your interest.

Here I will be picking up the hyperion base and integrating MYSQL and XStream.

If if I were to elaborate I would say to become more familiar with MYSQL. I have had prior knowledge before making this project but I really want to expand my knowledge of MYSQL and use it to its fullest. That is my personal goal but the overall goal of the project is to integrate MYSQL and Hyperion.[/quote]
Yes, I am seriously interested. And I’ve never tried MYSQL, don’t think I will.

Read full topic

item.title: Prestige Worldwide
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

The name is not official but I think it is a good start.

Welcome to back to basics. Here I will be picking up the hyperion base and integrating MYSQL and XStream. The reason I will be using MYSQL is simply HERE. It really is a powerful tool and I advise everybody to learn it (especially if your going to be using my release). I will also be using XStream for XML integration. If you want a basic guide on XStream you can visit here

Don’t expect any skills or bosses or whatever you guys expect. This is just more about the back end of a server.
I will come back later and elaborate more about my project and even provide snippets of progress as well as answering questions etc.

Below is the rs2_players table where all the players basic information will be stored. This is just a basic example, as you can see a lot more needs to be added. Also “h” is height and it is unsigned because the value is unable to go negative. I will have to double check this.

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `rs2_players` (
  `username` varchar(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
  `pass` varchar(20) NOT NULL,
  `creation_date` int(10) unsigned NOT NULL DEFAULT '0',
  `x` int(5) unsigned DEFAULT '3000',
  `y` int(5) unsigned DEFAULT '3000',
  `h` int(10) unsigned DEFAULT '0',
  `energy` int(10) DEFAULT '0',
  `skull` int(10) unsigned DEFAULT '0',
  `splitChat` tinyint(1) unsigned DEFAULT '0',
  `autoRetaliate` tinyint(1) unsigned DEFAULT '0',
}

Please note I am not a MYSQL expert or anything so if you see something I can improve or fix let me know :S

Read full topic
